website_summaries.verdict: A top notch telescope with professional-grade features. Expensive, but worth every bit.
pros: High-quality, lightweight telescope featuring impressive software
Versatile scope welcomes beginners and advanced users
cons: Telescope and accessories come at a high cost

customer_reviews.title: Ring of Saturn
customer_reviews.text: During the last new moon I saw the rings of saturn for the first time in my life, my picture doesnt do it justice, it was much clearer. This telescope is wonderful and was well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: 8/8 m8
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is incredible! absolutely love it. the mount is sturdy and reliable and very easy to use. the optics are easy to adjust. i've been able to see the orion nebula, andromeda galaxy, saturns rings, jupiters moons and cloud belts and of course craters on the moon. this telescope is the best that ive seen out there in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Zane Raines

customer_reviews.title: Amazing moon views!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I got a Barlow lense and moon filter for it, and was able to take this shot with my iPhone in my very first night of attempting any pictures. Be sure to set this up ahead of time, in the daylight. It might look complicated, but is pretty straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: J. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces and horrible assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible instructions for assembly, and MISSING PIECES. It's clear that no one was checking these before rushing them into boxes, and it's unfortunate because if just one piece is missing then the whole things can't be assembled. It might be a great view of the stars, but I'll never know because of lazy packaging and parts work.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing this telescope alone will not enable you to see the sky any better than looking up with your eyes. You will need to order additional lenses to see anything close up. It’s veeg big and looks nice but without additional lenses it’s like looking through a child’s toy.
customer_reviews.author: love to teach reading

customer_reviews.title: Came without an eyepiece.
customer_reviews.text: This expensive telescope came without an eyepiece. I bought it for my son and when I just visited, I found it is sitting unused in his living room. He was too embarrassed to tell me. Please send me an eyepiece.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah by the lake

customer_reviews.title: The Force is strong with this one...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this telescope about 4-5 months, and its in my top 10 list of favorite things I've ever bought. It makes stargazing much more interesting. Because it provides an amazing clear view, I've been able to see things that many people haven't seen before. My ONLY problem is that because its very heavy it can get difficult to move around. Objects I've been able to see clearly so far: The Moon (Duh), Venus, Mars, Jupiter, My Neighbor's house, Saturn, Pluto, Various astroids, Various Nebulas, Obviously, the Force is strong with this one...
customer_reviews.author: agid

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to leArn
customer_reviews.text: Learning to use The telescope is a skill so it’ll take time to figure it out. The instructions it comes with aren’t the best but the company has many YouTube videos available to make building it easy. I also re come de looking at videos not made by Orion as they are more beginner friendly. I’ve been able to see the moon very clearly but I did have to purchase some parts separately. I wouldn’t recommend this for someone who doesn’t want to invest time into learning how to use it. Another plus is that it looks so cool in my living room. I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Great starter and good working telescope!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Christmas. Is getting ready to retire and he's always wanted a telescope. He was a little nervous at first thinking it was a bit over his head but he went online and listened to some videos about how to use and he is very excited. He's learning more about astronomy by watching videos online and has found out that there are some accessories that he can buy to make viewing more fun. All in all, it was a very good investment for him since he will have days to play. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline B. McKee

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope, but not easily portable
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is great for a beginning to intermediate astronomer. Assembly isn't terribly difficult, but takes about an hour or so. This is not a portable telescope, however...you have to do a fair bit of disassembly in order to fit it in your car. So, it's probably best if you live in a dark area where you don't have to take it anywhere. This also means that it will take up a lot room in your house, so make sure you have a place to put it. This telescope does seem to be suitable for astrophotography. I knew a guy who had one like this, and he took some AMAZING pictures with it.
customer_reviews.author: VTDoubleE

customer_reviews.title: A New Hobby That Can Be Shared
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this scope. It was easy to set up, easier to focus and the visual from the two accompanying lenses are great. We have seen the rings of Saturn, Jupiter and 4 of it's moons. Our moon is beyond fascinating. It has become a past time that is fun and entertaining. We have a small planetarium nearby and our grandchildren will enjoy the scope so much more after the next planetarium visit. This is well worth the investment and as beginners it more than satisfies our curiosity. It just doesn't get boring or old!!
customer_reviews.author: AmzonPet

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the cheap construction of the frame. I'm a machinist so maybe just picky about this. I've got a bad back so find it a bit difficult to move around. I made pieces to easily remove the weight and reposition again. My wife who up till now had no interest in this watches all the Youtube vids on astronomy after seeing Saturn a few nights.
customer_reviews.author: Rosco Butter

customer_reviews.title: sturdy construction, excellent customer support
customer_reviews.text: High quality images, sturdy construction, excellent customer support. I had a minor problem with the equatorial mount (one of the slow motion movements was binding), and I contacted Orion Customer Service. A real person answered the phone! They sent me a new EQ with prepaid UPS return. Now all is good, and I enjoy exploring the night sky.
customer_reviews.author: Duane D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for an intermediate star watcher
customer_reviews.text: This telescope was much bigger and heavier than I expected. It is on furniture slides to make it easier to move to the outside. But it is fantastic for viewing the moon and stars. They are sharp and clear. My daughter has put a camera on it and is learning how to take pictures. It was challenging to put together, I ended up going to YouTube. But that may have been because it is so different than the other telescopes I have had. All in all, it was a great buy! Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: LindaR

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear view of Jupiter right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Immediately after assembling, we took it outside and pointed it at the brightest object in the sky. What we got was a CRYSTAL clear view of Jupiter and 4 of it's moons! We could even make out 3 of the red bands. Assembly was easy, but Watching Orion's YouTube videos beforehand was helpful. We don't quite understand the equatorial mount, but we were aware of the 'learning curve' before we made the purchase, so no problems there.
customer_reviews.author: David Maze

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Scope
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. Well made and easy to use. Doesn't take up much space with the Short Tube, but.........remember.......the Short Tube takes away from some of the magnification. Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with the scope and would highly recommend for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Graham

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I saw Jupiter. Like seeing a celebrity. You hear about it, see pictures your whole life than BOOM there she is. Its small, and you cant touch the telescope, cause you do notice a little shake but if its still you can see the lines of the planet. No question its Jupiter. Im not going to say the assembly is a piece of cake but im sure anyone can do it. Hint: make sure the finder scope is dead on. Its hard to find even the full moon if it isn’t. O and the moon! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Allen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Okay--first of all, if you're looking at the Orion Starblast 4.5 and trying to decide between that and this, GET THIS. For a few bucks more, you're getting the "Cadillac" here for sure....THIS THING ROCKS. That's all there is to it. Easy to set up, easy to carry outdoors (more cumbersome than heavy) and PLENTY powerful enough. Only thing is, when you get this baby and you're as serious as I am about astronomy, you'll be shopping for lenses next, and that'll set ya back more than this scope itself.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Rognstad

customer_reviews.title: I've enjoyed watching the stars and taking pictures
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed watching the stars and taking pictures. Clarity has been great the only downside is that I have found where the directions. In putting everything together it took much longer then was written in the directions, mainly because it needed to be put in a layman's term. but the enjoyment has been tremendous
customer_reviews.author: Susan q

customer_reviews.title: Assembly manual does not list exactly all parts.
customer_reviews.text: Just used used it for the first time. Takes a little bit getting used to. Very happy with it so far. Photo attached was taken from Google phone 25 mm eyepiece. M37 cluster.
customer_reviews.author: Rng. Rick

customer_reviews.title: Reach for the Stars
customer_reviews.text: While there is still so much too learn about Astronomy and using the telescope to its full specifications. The opportunities to see the Moon, Jupiter and the rings of Saturn thru my Orion SpaceProbe 130ST telescope, was worth the wait and the investment. I am also learning that Investing in the right eyepieces for the telescope, will further enhance our viewing experience for many, many evenings and for family and friends of all ages. Thank you, Rafael Cardona
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Cardona

customer_reviews.title: It is okay
customer_reviews.text: The problem is the weight, it is very bulky. Not very mobile. I set it up with help but haven't used it, and the accessory tray fell off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
customer_reviews.text: We bought our first telescope this Christmas and have had several opportunities to enjoy watching the stars. One thing I do recommend to anyone considering this, be sure to get the accessory kit as it has many filters and lens enhancements that add a lot of value. I'm not a fan of the instructions however, its just a brief step by step without showing any pictures of how to properly assemble the telescope. The manual could be much written and published much better if they included staged photos of each step because it can be confusing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Naeve

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner scope
customer_reviews.text: This amazing telescope makes distant pricks of light look like slightly closer pricks of light.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Howe

customer_reviews.title: It's bigger than you think it is and goes together very easily. Super solid metal construction on the joints/heavy lifting ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter, works very well as a beginner telescope. It's bigger than you think it is and goes together very easily. Super solid metal construction on the joints/heavy lifting parts, easy to transport in an SUV or Truck but don't expect an easy ride for this in a small car. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: BKDMino

customer_reviews.title: YouTube Video is the only way to figure out assembly
customer_reviews.text: Was a beast to assemble. Fortunately there was a YouTube video
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for learning
customer_reviews.text: This is my first telescope, and I'm learning alot. Have got to see a couple meteors and nebula. The moon is very detailed too. Having problems getting views of planets I was hoping for. Not sure if I need a filter or if its collimation(which has been the biggest learning curve for me.) Seeing Jupiter as a ball of light but its still neat to see its moons. Learning how to use mount can be tricky especially if you don't polar align. Word of advice watch youtube videos on collimation and polar alignment before messing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I love my scope. Now this comes from someone who had a celestron scope for 21 years with a broken tripod after 2 yrars. But its great. Spotterscope alignment went easy, everything is smooth though ra control is a bit stiff. Would like an easier breakdown on tripod when traveling to light free areas. So a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Hedgepeth

customer_reviews.title: Very good beginner telescope
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and put together. Don’t be discouraged by other reviews saying other wise. This is my first telescope I’ve ever bought or put my hands on. The pictures I’ve included were taken with the lenses that came with the telescope. Very easy to find the moon and being the image into focus. Just took me a few minutes of practice on an ideal night.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Taken me on a great journey
customer_reviews.text: This telescope has made me appreciate the heavens even more than previously. Although I live in a big urban city, the seeings and light pollution are the major obstacles for a perfect observation session. However, my Orion telescope has taken me on a tour of Saturn and its rings, Jupiter and its storms, countless galaxies and at last, the craters of the moon. The telescope itself is very well made, sturdy, and easy to work with. I would easily recommend it for any novice astronomer.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a wonderful telescope which is NOT for beginners! My husband calls it his own private Hubble telescope. Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.author: K. Dehaven

customer_reviews.title: Buy another scope from another company.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my real review won't be processed so the item was meh. Needed additional parts was a birthday gift very dissatisfied and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: SellEverything

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: We use this almost every weekend, skies permitting. It's so much fun to search the skies for stars you cant see with the naked eye. I would recommend this for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa831

customer_reviews.title: Amazing telescope for the price!
customer_reviews.text: If you are in the market for a really nice beginner/intermediate telescope look no further. This package really packs a punch when it comes to quality and expansion. The optics are outstanding, the optional motor drive works great, it's easy to set up, and the customer support is second to none. Can also dabble in some astrophotography as well. Do yourself a favor and buy this. If not as a beginner/intermediate telescope, buy it as a second backup scope! You will not regret it. I was very impressed with the quality and everything that was included for the price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for the boyfriend!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend for his birthday; he just recently finished an astronomy class so he was thrilled to get this! Looking at the craters and details on the moon was really cool to me. Then a few nights later he showed me Jupiter. You could make out some contrast on the planet and three moons around it! It was pretty easy to put together and he absolutely loves it. Major brownie points for me! :)
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette Pisco

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners, don't miss anything in the sky now
customer_reviews.text: This is great for beginners. So much going on in the sky this year and now I don't miss a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dastokes

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: My first decent telescope- I reviewed every telescope in this low price range. I wanted a better telescope but no electronics, I like the idea of having an electronic telescope but it was not in the budget. I feel I got a much better telescope without paying extra for the gadgets. The Orion 130ST is a nice beginner telescope with some advanced features. My first night out was spectacular, We were able to see Jupiter perfectly with all of its bands of color. I recommend getting a selection a eyepieces because this telescope is capable of some pretty cool deep-space viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Pelkey

customer_reviews.title: Moon Viewing Only
customer_reviews.text: This product is reasonably well constructed and straightforward instructions make setup fairly simple. I found that it is primarily useful for viewing the moon. Magnification is as described.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Watts

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner telescope!
customer_reviews.text: Using a 2x lens adapter and a moon filter we had a great view of the full Moon and Lunar Eclipse! This was easy to set up and just as easy to learn to use. Well, I didn't do a Polar Alignment and we just blindly pointed at the objects we wanted to see. It worked out perfectly! :) I HIGHLY recommend this scope as a beginner scope and look forward to seeing what she can do once we are not under a street light.
customer_reviews.author: F2

customer_reviews.title: Overall very pleased,
customer_reviews.text: Still learning but have seen Jupiter and 4 moons, Saturn's rings and Mars. Not too difficult to assemble though a bit confusing on balancing thscope. Overall very pleased,
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Brew

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is a great buy for someone wanting to move up from the little refractor you got as a kid and start moving into the world of serious astronomy. Its great for checking out the bright planets visible at any particular moment. Its rather heavy but the good ones always are for stability. Assembly intructions are straightforward but it takes some mechanical ability and organization to get it put together and set up correctly. Its well worth the entry-level price. Have fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bow or Stroke oar

customer_reviews.title: Watching the stars!
customer_reviews.text: Takes a moment to set up properly, but once you do that things work well.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Was quite a big deal setting it up, but if you work carefully it’s pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to assemble and set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this telescope for my 15 year old son. It is his first telescope. I read all the reviews and was worried about the set-up and assembly. It was VERY EASY. From out of the box to his getting a great view of some planets was 2 hours. NO issues at all. Just wanted to put other parents mind at ease. He has enjoyed it quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: chuck Arnold

customer_reviews.title: help to limit vibrations
customer_reviews.text: I am not writing a full review for right now. Some have mentioned that the telescope shakes when focusing or making other adjustments. I have just added 3 5lb ankle weights to the legs. They are easy to put on and take off and store. Try it and you will find that it will help.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great scope
customer_reviews.text: Great telescope very well made and a little heavy. l like how it feels and once you balance the telescope it was very easy to spot objects ion the sky would recommend this scope for a beginner the only gripe i have is it came in so many boxes it was like overdone, LOL
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good telescope
customer_reviews.text: We had some trouble setting up, but after that it was great. Never realize how beautiful the moon was
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice view
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t call this a beginners telescope. It is nice but it took us a while to get it together having no experience with telescopes. This was for my pre-teen daughter who is fascinated with space. It’s okay to put in one place and use. Definitely wouldn’t plan on moving it much. I would say it’s a little more advanced than beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great first telescope
customer_reviews.text: Thus was bought for my 12 year old daughter and she loves this thing. You can see alot of things with it. It was easy to set up and align, it did not require much fine tuning at all.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item, you just need to see the YouTube assembly video and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: J Aristizbal

customer_reviews.title: Lovely telescope
customer_reviews.text: I love my new scope and look forward to trying a Barlow lens I just bought. I wish there was a quick release for the tool tray. It makes it hard to set up when I bring it somewhere, which is usually the case since there isn't much to see from home, in a bright city.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Best to go by the YouTube instructions. Was missing a small wing screw that holds the assessory tray in place. No problem...I thought. Contacted Orion. They said they don't send missing parts if the equipment was purchased through a 3rd party...ie Amazon. Good thing the missing piece was not something more important. You would think she would pick up the phone, called parts, give them my address and have them shoot the little 55 cent screw to me. And then have a happy customer. Seems that was be too difficult for Orion. Wished I would have checked out Celestron's policy before purchasing a scope. It was a toss-up between the two.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great value...very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This product is a beginners dream..One caveat ie the instructions booklet: the parts nomenclature in the directions for assembly often fail to match the parts list..Most assemblers will have some difficulty in overcoming this...So, expect double the estimated 30-minute assembly time..It's a problem that Orion would be wise to address..IMO
customer_reviews.author: Patrick De'Ment

customer_reviews.title: Very cool !
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen or put together such a cool item before. It was a gift for a friend and she just loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Michelle Schnorbus

customer_reviews.title: The Orion 130ST is a great mid level telescope system
customer_reviews.text: The Orion 130ST is a great mid level telescope system. it has some nice bells and whistles on it, I had no issues putting it together as I have had similar weighted bases, to someone who is not a hands on/put together yourself person might be a little intimidating. My family and I were able to see the moon and the creators clearly as well as some additional stars - sorry dont know their names not that professional - but has the kids interested in science and engineering and speeding several hours a week using it (when weather/clouds allow)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is super happy with this. We are not professionals by any means but you should have heard him when we looked at the nebula in Orion's Belt!
customer_reviews.author: Christa Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: great optics
customer_reviews.text: Good construction and materials. Took a bit longer to assemble than advertised, but I am old and have limitations. First use was of daytime moon. Excellent views. I use it for star-gazing most of all. Overall, I"m very happy with the Orion.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Alot of bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, good quality. For the price you get quite a piece of equipment. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice telescope.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he had no trouble putting it together and seems to really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Brigman-White

customer_reviews.title: A higher end beginners telescope.
customer_reviews.text: The mount that holds the secondary mirror is a bit flimsy and makes collimating harder then it should be. With this scope you will be able to see things like star clusters, Jupiter and its moons, Saturn's rings, and some nebulas. On a good night with no moon most things that are a mag 5.0 or better are visible.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Mong

customer_reviews.title: Great for newbies
customer_reviews.text: After extensive research of which telescope to buy (knowing nothing about the hobby except what a few forums and reviews could tell me) I settled on this one. Bought as a Christmas gift for my husband and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Marni

customer_reviews.title: As advertised but overwhelming
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic when you can get it to work. There are so many moving parts and we have issues trying to adjust it accordingly. When we look through the finder and identify what to use the telescope on they are never aligned. I'm sure it's user error and in time we will get it dialed in but it's a bit intimidating putting it together. We made a statement opening the box saying our degrees are in finance and Criminal Justice/philosplophy/psychology not in Astonomy/Astrology nor Engineering. It's as asvertised but a bit overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick E. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and the images are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Got some amazing moon shots on day one. I know almost nothing about telescopes so far but the YouTube videos on how to assemble it made it so easy, I did it with a baby in tow, and the ease of use is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice telescope for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby is really excited to get to use his new telescope!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Tberry

customer_reviews.title: freaking sweet!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After asembly I was able to see a planet. I think it was Jupiter. It looked almost exactly like the pitures you see on the Internet. I was amazed by this. I live in the city and I can still see planets!! Freaking sweet.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Im a novice at best but my son took astronomy in college and he's impressed. 👍
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Having a great time using this product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, we can't believe what we can view through this telescope. High quality and ease of operation. Having a great time viewing the heavens, JB
customer_reviews.author: Jeff JB

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are horrible but my son and I figured it out and ...
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are horrible but my son and I figured it out and put it together in about 30 minutes. We used the picture a lot to get it done. The weather hasn't been great so we haven't had a chance to try it yet.
customer_reviews.author: L. Burns

customer_reviews.title: bought this for my husband and he just loves it ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my husband and he just loves it. There is a video that explains how to set it up which is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my son, (over 30) his reaction was "mom this is the best present ever, we have a roof top deck and we went up there and to see the actual craters of the moon, is amazing.!! Evrerytime someone comes over we take them up to the roof to view the sky! Easy to use, exceeded our expectations of what we could actually see.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super cool, went and picked up a separate barlow tube and caught some amazing photos.
customer_reviews.author: shannon m riley

customer_reviews.title: Al
customer_reviews.text: Awesome telescope. If you have an Ipad you can get a .99 app that can find anything and then you can sight it and look. Tried auto find telescopes and sent two back as auto systems to "find" objects never worked from the beginiing.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope at great price
customer_reviews.text: This was my husband's first telescope. Great for watching the moon,stars. Not to easy to assemble but not hard enough that you can't you tube it. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: The weather's been a bit cold for a lot of observations since I got this, but unit was easily put together, the mount works well and my early usage, mainly of the Moon with my son showed very clear image . as spring arrives, I'll hopefully get better opportunity to really see what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: Footcenter

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my younger son's 30th birthday gift. He was completely surprised at the "professional level" of this telescope. Later, he told me that it was easy to put together and set up. He and his wife are enjoying star-gazing, especially viewing the recent "blood moon" on April 14-15. He was able to take great photos of the lunar eclipse by putting his camera up to the eye piece of the telescope. I also purchased the Orion 05662 moon-lens AND the Orion padded telescope case. I'm glad I chose all three items to make it a complete package and my son is ecstatic over the performance of this telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Domino

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best $300 to spend to start a new hobby in astronomy!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice hobbyist level item. I've had for about 3 weeks and very happy with it. Nice stable tripod, and easy to setup. Just dial in to Polaris and then you'll be able to get right after what you are looking for. I attached my Nikon digital camera to this and have several nice snapshots...Jupiter moons, lunar features, comet Lovejoy.. The setting circles are very handy and good to learn how to navigate the sky with. Highly recommended for a starter scope. Has professional features, with a budget price. I have the Celestron lens kit with this..works well, and with barlow, very flexible viewing options. I've ordered the clock drive...can't wait to try that out!
customer_reviews.author: John Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope
customer_reviews.text: I really like this telescope. It is my first reflector eq type, so it took a bit to set up and adjust. Very impressed with the quality and view. Since my initial purchase I also purchased planet filters, 3x Barlow, and the soft case. All make it even that much better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for New Astronomers
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent telescope for the beginner at a very good price, from an excellent company. The optics are exceptional for this price range and construction quality is first rate. You will need to add more eyepieces and filters to maximize its capability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son-in-law who is a night owl. He loves it and spends hours on it every night that it is clear.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Doc

customer_reviews.title: General impression so far = great scope
customer_reviews.text: This is the scope we chose to introduce ourselves and our 11yo daughter to home astronomy. The scope is incredibly impressive in appearance and we learned quite a bit just learning how to properly use it. We've only been able to try it out from our roof so far and the ambient light has not been the best for viewing but we're hoping to get out to the dessert in the next day or two. Definitely would recommend an additional barlow lens and one of the many kits with multiple filters. As we get a little better at using the scope we'll come back to update our review but as a first impression this is a great scope.
customer_reviews.author: Dignow DXB

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Read instructions to assemble, wasn’t difficult if you pay attention to details. Works well. Fits in my Audi A4 to transport
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: My husband LOVES this telescope a it's great at looking closely at the moon and stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this telescope a it's great at looking closely at the moon and stars. He lives that with a few cheap attachments that he can take astro-photography as well. Great telescope for our whole family!
customer_reviews.author: BS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing views
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product and able to see the moon so clearly. Somewhat difficult to move around but only because of its size

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful telescope for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product but instructions were not the best for assembly. Excellent visibility.

customer_reviews.title: THIS TELESCOPE IS TOTALLY AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: THIS TELESCOPE IS PERFECT FOR SEEING THE MOON, PLANETS AND WITH A SOLAR FILTER THE SUN. I BOUGHT A 3X BARROW LENS AND A 4MM LENSE AND YOU WOULD NOT BELIEVE THE VIEWS YOU GET
customer_reviews.author: don bovitz

customer_reviews.title: Breathtaking
customer_reviews.text: Even better than I imagined. I'm able to see every planet with detail. Saturn is the most breathtaking one to see.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Smith

customer_reviews.title: Gteat telescope
customer_reviews.text: First, I'm no professional; strictly a beginner. But I really enjoy this product. The assembly out of the box was simple and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Headley

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for any ardent sky-watcher!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband for Christmas and it was a big hit. It's size and quality is very impressive. The whole family is having a great time recognizing the stars and finding the constellations!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: easy to use  but there is some issue view is reversed :)
customer_reviews.text: its a good choice moon and saturn :) awesome view ... ..but there is no 2mm Alen wranch pls add it to packet :) thx you
customer_reviews.author: Harut

customer_reviews.title: Google how to align
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and we enjoy using it. It is a little hard to align.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A Bucknam

customer_reviews.title: Saw the rings of Saturn the first night
customer_reviews.text: Great scope! We unboxed it and set it up fairly quickly. The directions on operation could be a little clearer. I took it out on our deck and used my Stellarium app to find Saturn. A few adjustments and it came into view. Nothing spectacular but you could clearly see the rings. I purchased a 2x Barlow and a 6mm objective lens to really pull it in. Now it is much clearer and includes several of the moons. Can't wait for the comet in November!
customer_reviews.author: Eric S Cromwell

customer_reviews.title: Wow, great scope, that grows with you!
customer_reviews.text: Great telescope. 1.25-inch lends size. Best, so far, for checking out the moon. I also check out Ersa minor, which still looks like small shine dots. Can stand up to weather, I have this out on the balcony of my apartment in Denver; handles weather fine. durable and has 2 control knobs that allow you to quickly follow a star when it moves. Great entry level telescope that can upgrade to your hearts content. This scope can grow with you.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Leone

customer_reviews.title: but several Youtube Vids make it really easy to assemble and to use
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with everything it said it would. The directions are a little complicated, but several Youtube Vids make it really easy to assemble and to use. Good quality workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! It is so fascinating seeing the craters ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! It is so fascinating seeing the craters on the moon. We were also able to see Jupiter and it’s moons.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful scope easy set up easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Love the scope haven't been able to use use it as much as I'd like and suggest buying better lenses than what comes with it

customer_reviews.text: Awesome telescope. Much better than I expected for the price. Have bought two of these now as gifts.

customer_reviews.text: Very well-made, fairly easy to assemble for amateurs. Glad we spent a little more $$ for one that is a step up (or two) from a "beginners" telescope.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a begginer, but I love my new telescope. I am learning about it, and I know that I need to learn more and more, but it seems like I going to enjoy it!

customer_reviews.title: I like this, but terrible instructions
customer_reviews.text: I like this, but terrible instructions. Still struggle with alignment, but great views of the moon when out. I do not think it is a good choice for a beginner like it says.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Clancy

product_meta.title: Orion 09007 SpaceProbe 130ST Equatorial Reflector Telescope (Black)
product_meta.description: Our largest aperture SpaceProbe reflector telescope is the niftiest Newtonian reflector on an equatorial mount we've seen in a long time. The Orion SpaceProbe 130ST EQ Reflector Telescope is a step up from the standard SpaceProbe 130 EQ for the more serious beginning or intermediate stargazer who wants additional performance, particularly for targeting deep-sky objects. Just what's so nifty about the Orion SpaceProbe 130ST Equatorial Reflector Telescope? The answer is best described as short and sweet. First, the short. This ST, or Short Tube, version of the SpaceProbe 130 reflector is indeed more compact than the standard model. The 130ST reflector telescope's optical tube measures 24 inches long compared to 33 inches on the standard 130. The focal length of the ST's 130mm (5.1inch) primary mirror is 650mm (f/5), yielding a wider field of view and brighter images for a given telescope eyepiece focal length. That brings us to sweet. The 130mm aperture primary is a diffraction-limited parabolic mirror, the same type used on much larger reflector telescopes costing many times as much. On a short-focal-length design like this one, a parabolic mirror is a must for focusing incoming light to a point and delivering sharp, detailed images. Moreover, the secondary mirror is held in an advanced holder with thin 0.5mm metal vanes, to reduce diffraction spikes and light loss. These features combined with the included 25mm (26x power) and 10mm (65x power) Sirius Plossl telescope eyepieces and quick-release 6x30 achromatic finder scope make this one sweet optical system for astronomy! The SpaceProbe 130ST EQ reflector telescope also includes a collimation cap and center-marked primary mirror for easy optical alignment. The Orion SpaceProbe 130ST telescope comes on a sturdy and precise EQ-2 equatorial mount with dual setting circles and slow-motion hand controls.
feature_bullets: This 5.1 inch aperture reflector telescope gathers an ample amount of light for great views of the planets and Moon, as well as brighter galaxies, nebulas, and star clusters

Short 24 inch long optical tube design for easy portability and fast f/5 focal ratio for pleasing wide-field performance makes the SpaceProbe 130ST EQ a very versatile telescope the whole family can enjoy
Complete assembled telescope weighs just 27 lbs. for convenient transport. Best for imaging- Lunar & planetary
Includes two 1.25 inch Sirius Plossl eyepieces (25mm and 10mm), 6x30 finder scope, 1.25inch rack and pinion focuser, tripod accessory tray, collimation cap, Starry Night astronomy software, and more!

Sturdy EQ-2 equatorial telescope mount and adjustable tripod allows manual slow-motion tracking of celestial objects as they appear to migrate across the night sky , Counterweight bar length - 8 inches
